alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 1:35PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Washington, southwestern Clarke, southeastern Wayne and northeastern Greene Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 135 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Tibbie, or 9 miles south of Chatom, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Chatom, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Leroy, Tibbie, Millry, State Line, Fruitdale and McIntosh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
